description: Late Middle English, borrowed from Latin inceptiō, from inceptus, Perfect passive participle of incipiō (“I begin”).

The layering sense derives from the 2010 science fiction film Inception, in which a team of people infiltrate someone’s subconscious mind, proceeding through several layers of dreams with the goal of causing someone to incept an idea.

entries.meaning: The creation or beginning of something; the establishment.
examples: From its inception, the agency has been helping people obtain and properly install car seats for children.

entries.meaning: A layering, nesting, or recursion of something. [from 2010s]
